metadata.title: CVE-2024-33600 on Ubuntu 23.10 (mantic) - medium
metadata.description:
nscd: Null pointer crashes after notfound response If the Name ServiceCache Daemon's (nscd) cache fails to add a not-found netgroup response tothe cache, the client request can result in a null pointer dereference.This flaw was introduced in glibc 2.15 when the cache was added to nscd.This vulnerability is only present in the nscd binary.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-33600` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

glibc-source - 2.38-1ubuntu6.3
libc-bin - 2.38-1ubuntu6.3
libc6 - 2.38-1ubuntu6.3
libc6-amd64 - 2.38-1ubuntu6.3
libc6-i386 - 2.38-1ubuntu6.3
libc6-prof - 2.38-1ubuntu6.3
libc6-s390 - 2.38-1ubuntu6.3
libc6-x32 - 2.38-1ubuntu6.3
locales - 2.38-1ubuntu6.3
locales-all - 2.38-1ubuntu6.3
nscd - 2.38-1ubuntu6.3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: glibc package in mantic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.38-1ubuntu6.3').
